item.title: Motion Estimation and Video Coding Toolbox
item.description: Motion Estimation Our approach to motion estimation in video sequences was motivated by the general scheme of the current video coders with motion compensation (such as MPEG-X or H.26X [Musmann85, LeGall91, Tekalp95]). In motion compensation video coders the input sequence, A(t), is analized by a motion estimation system, M, that computes some description of the motion in the scene: typically the optical flow, DVF(t). In the motion compensation module, P, this motion information can be used to predict the current frame, A(t), from previous frames, A(t-1).
